title: Requires funeral directors to post signs relating to the benefits afforded to deceased veterans and their families
summary: Requires funeral directors to post signs, in at least twelve point conspicuous print, relating to the benefits afforded to deceased veterans and their families and how to obtain such benefits.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3026

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 21, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. CALHOUN, CASTELLI -- read once and referred to
         the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to requiring  funeral
         directors to post an informational sign notifying families of deceased
         veterans of certain benefits

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 3441-a of the public  health  law,  as  amended  by
    2  chapter 534 of the laws of 1983, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S  3441-a.  Funeral arrangements; [use of flag] DECEASED VETERANS.  1.
    4  Upon the request of the person responsible for the payment  for  funeral
    5  arrangements made for the care and disposition of the body of a deceased
    6  veteran,  eligible  under  federal  law  or  regulations  or section two
    7  hundred fifty-a of the military law for the use of a United States  flag
    8  for  burial  purposes,  every  person licensed pursuant to this article,
    9  including funeral directors and funeral firms, shall  furnish  a  United
   10  States  flag  for  the covering of the casket at the time of the funeral
   11  free of charge. Notice of the availability of such flag shall  be  given
   12  at the time the itemized list of services is furnished.
   13    2.  IN  ADDITION TO THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION,
   14  SUCH FUNERAL DIRECTORS AND FUNERAL FIRMS SHALL POST, IN AT LEAST  TWELVE
   15  POINT  CONSPICUOUS  PRINT,  A  SIGN NOTIFYING THE FAMILIES OF A DECEASED
   16  VETERAN WHAT SERVICES AND BENEFITS ARE  AFFORDED  TO  THEM  AND  HOW  TO
   17  OBTAIN SUCH BENEFITS.
   18    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   19  it shall have become a law.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
